Posts.Content: May 12, 2013 06:37AM - edited May 12, 2013 06:38AM by src3acs I had bilateral mastectomy with DIEP in Oct 2012 and the day before that had lung surgery to remove a nodule.  Was in the hospital 10 days and slept in a recliner for a very long time.  Be patient....I too was stooped over for a while...which is very normal....but you will stand straight again.  I had terrible back pain and sometimes I still get sore.  I found physical therapy to help both the pain and the posture.  Physical Therapist said this type of surgery (breast and belly) really weakens all of the abdominal muscles so we work a lot of stretching and strengthening.  I agree with Ysa above...don't overdo  it.
